events.description: R.O. sends a series of threatening emails to Mark L. Epstein, demanding $25,000 and threatening to release documents and a letter to the New York Post and other media outlets.

keyFacts: An individual named R.O. attempted to extort $25,000 from Mark L. Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, in June 2020.
The extortion threat involved releasing a letter written by Jeffrey Epstein to Mark L. Epstein to the New York Post and other media.
R.O. claimed to possess documents showing connections with 'two female models' and information found from Mark L. Epstein's computer.
The threats referenced 'all the sexual victims' of Jeffrey Epstein, attempting to leverage the case for financial gain.
